required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic Migraine Epidemiology and Outcomes Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a population internet-based study to characterize migraine clinical course and impact on family.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Episodic Migraine (EM) or Chronic Migraine (CM)
primary_outcome.description: EM is defined as <15 headache days/month and CM is defined as ≥15 headache days/month.

The Midas score is a patient completed 5-item questionnaire about lost time and productivity (for work, school or family/social activities) in the past 3 months (number of days missed) where: 0-5=Little or No disability, 6-10=Mild disability, 11-20=Moderate disability or 21+ Severe disability. The Midas scores assessed at Months 3, 6, 9 and 12 were averaged.

arm_group.description: Participants who returned completed internet survey with positive screening for migraines. No intervention was administered in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History of migraine
- U.S. Member of Survey Panel
- Household member of study participant
- Ability to complete internet-based questionnaires
Exclusion Criteria:
- No access to internet

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This study was an internet survey to identify participants with Episodic Migraine (EM) and Chronic Migraine (CM). The participants were followed for up to 1 year by assessments every 3 months.

group.title: Participants With Migraines
group.description: Participants who returned completed internet survey with positive screening for migraines. No intervention was administered in this study.

group.title: Participants With Migraines
group.description: Participants who returned completed internet survey with positive screening for migraines. No intervention was administered in this study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Episodic Migraine (EM) or Chronic Migraine (CM)
outcome.description: EM is defined as <15 headache days/month and CM is defined as ≥15 headache days/month.
outcome.population: All qualified participants at Baseline who returned completed survey with positive screening for migraines.

group.title: Participants With Migraines
group.description: Participants who returned completed internet survey with positive screening for migraines. No intervention was administered in this study.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Episodic Migraine (EM) or Chronic Migraine (CM)
measure.description: EM is defined as <15 headache days/month and CM is defined as ≥15 headache days/month.
measure.population: All qualified participants at Baseline who returned completed survey with positive screening for migraines.

outcome.title: Migraine Disability Assessment (MIDAS)
outcome.description: The Midas score is a patient completed 5-item questionnaire about lost time and productivity (for work, school or family/social activities) in the past 3 months (number of days missed) where: 0-5=Little or No disability, 6-10=Mild disability, 11-20=Moderate disability or 21+ Severe disability. The Midas scores assessed at Months 3, 6, 9 and 12 were averaged.
outcome.population: All qualified participants at Baseline who returned completed survey with positive screening for migraines.

group.title: Participants With Episodic Migraine
group.description: Participants who returned completed internet survey with Episodic Migraine defined as <15 headache days/month. No intervention was administered in this study.

group.title: Participants With Chronic Migraine
group.description: Participants who returned completed internet survey with Chronic Migraine defined as ≥15 headache days/month. No intervention was administered in this study.

measure.title: Migraine Disability Assessment (MIDAS)
measure.description: The Midas score is a patient completed 5-item questionnaire about lost time and productivity (for work, school or family/social activities) in the past 3 months (number of days missed) where: 0-5=Little or No disability, 6-10=Mild disability, 11-20=Moderate disability or 21+ Severe disability. The Midas scores assessed at Months 3, 6, 9 and 12 were averaged.
measure.population: All qualified participants at Baseline who returned completed survey with positive screening for migraines.

reported_events.desc: No Adverse Event data was collected in this study.

group.title: Participants With Migraines
group.description: Participants who returned completed internet survey with positive screening for migraines. No intervention was administered in this study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
